alert.note: Alert for Clark; Day; Marshall (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 11 at 1:25PM MDT until October 12 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND DRY FUELS FOR NORTHEAST SOUTH DAKOTA... The National Weather Service in Aberdeen has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds, which is in effect from 1 PM to 8 PM CDT Wednesday. * AFFECTED AREA...In South Dakota, Marshall, Day and Clark. * WINDS...Northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 30 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of strong and gusty winds, low humidity, and cured fine fuels could result in critical fire weather conditions over portions of northeast South Dakota.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
